text.text:
Top-Notch Care and Hospitality

During our recent stay at The Leela Palace Bangalore for the Keysight Conference, we had the pleasure of being assisted by Nathaniel, one of the butlers at the hotel. From the moment we arrived, Nathaniel went above and beyond to ensure our comfort and convenience.

He was attentive, thoughtful, and incredibly professional throughout our stay. Whether it was helping us with last-minute requests, guiding us through the property, or ensuring we had everything we needed during the conference, Nathaniel handled everything with grace and efficiency. His warm demeanor and attention to detail truly enhanced our experience at the Leela.

It’s rare to come across someone so genuinely committed to guest service. Nathaniel is a true asset to The Leela Palace, and we’re grateful for the care and hospitality he extended to us.

Highly recommended!

text.text:
Disappointing Experience at The Leela Palace, Bangalore

I recently visited The Leela Palace for an event and was quite disappointed by the overall experience, especially considering it’s a 5-star property.

Rude staff behavior: On arrival, while searching for the restroom and event venue, I was misdirected twice. A staff member (appeared to be a manager) rudely yelled at us once he realized we were from the event, saying we weren't allowed in that area.

No place to work: I had an urgent office call and couldn’t find a place to sit in the event area. When I moved to the garden, security asked me to leave. At the reception area, I was forced to sit on the floor. Staff kept rudely shooing us away without suggesting a proper spot to work from.

Inadequate facilities: Only one washroom was available for a large crowd. It became dirty quickly, with no prompt cleaning. Paint was peeling in several areas, which was surprising for a hotel of this stature.

For a premium hotel hosting corporate guests, the lack of courtesy, basic amenities, and professionalism was very disappointing.

text.text:
Comfortable Stay, But Deeply Disappointing Dining Experience

The Ritz-Carlton hotel itself is very comfortable. I had no issues with the stay — the rooms and amenities met expectations. However, I made the mistake of booking a package that included two meals a day (breakfast and dinner), and this turned out to be a major regret.

Dinner is served at The Market, the hotel's so-called continental restaurant, and both the food and service were truly disappointing. The atmosphere is chaotic — dim lighting combined with loud conversations made it hard to relax. The food, even by the standards of Indian-style continental cuisine, was objectively bad.

I highly recommend not including the lunch or dinner package in your booking. Breakfast was decent, but dinner was a daily struggle.

Over the course of three nights, my companion and I left more than half of our food uneaten. I wonder if the staff ever paused to consider what that might mean. This restaurant simply does not live up to the global standards of the Ritz-Carlton brand.

It became something I dreaded each evening, and I’m honestly relieved that I no longer have to eat dinner here.

Ritz in Bangalore is in the central part of Bangalore with lots to do around the area. The decor is  opulent that blends style and luxury well. Plenty of restaurants and food options and from my room I could hear live music late into the night which made it feel lively.

The rooms are spacious and luxurious. The only reason for me to give them a lower rating is that there was smell in the bedding and in the bathrobe; I didn’t expect this from Ritz. And the smell was bad, musty, stale and giving a feeling of unwashed.

Rest of the experience was great. The staff was welcoming, kind and the service was as I would expect from Ritz- outstanding!

text.text:
What a disaster of service!! Completely undeserving of what is otherwise a great property with spacious good rooms, and even bigger dis service to the brand of Ritz.

Be very sure that you have triple checked that the car is there at the airport for you, if you have paid the good dollars to get one for airport transfers. Chances are the airport representatives who are well trained to act innocent and say ‘sorry’ at the drop of a hat, may not have your booking and make you wait for almost an hour to get someone else’ booked car to fetch you. Great welcome at the airport!!

Make sure and feel your duty to humbly request the housekeeping to clean your room, else even at 4pm in the evening your room may look like this. The answer is very convenient- we do time management 😊. Meaning they will manage their time to ensure that you remain in the discomfort of an unclean room even after almost the day is over and evening is approaching. May be Ritz Carlton has a different definition of room cleaning and turn down!

text.text:
Terrible Experience – This Hotel Is Anything But “Grand”

My stay at Hotel Grand Kalinga in Bangalore was extremely disappointing. The moment we arrived, we noticed a strong stench in the lift and the room. The bed sheets were smelly and clearly not fresh, the room was unhygienic, and the closet was broken and unusable.

The so-called "complimentary breakfast" was a joke — there were just a few bread crumbs left with no refills in sight. Despite multiple guests requesting more food, the staff didn’t respond. When we politely asked about it, the manager came out and behaved rudely, shouting at us and others, saying we should have come at 8 AM. This was shocking, especially since we were told at check-in that breakfast would be available until 10:30 AM — we arrived at 9:30, well within that time.

The manager’s attitude was unprofessional and disrespectful. His rude behavior and lack of basic courtesy were unacceptable and set a terrible tone for our stay. This hotel may have “Grand” in its name, but it was anything but. I strongly advise avoiding this place — it's not worth your time or money.

We stayed at Hotel Royal Orchid in a Deluxe King Size Room from June 21 to July 4 as a family with a child, and had a really enjoyable experience.

The staff were friendly and helpful, especially when it came to housekeeping — the room could’ve been a bit cleaner at first, but they responded quickly and took care of it when asked. The hotel amenities were great and added a lot to our stay, especially with a kid — everything felt safe, comfortable, and well-managed.

Dining was excellent — good variety, tasty food, and smooth service. The location is convenient, and the overall vibe of the hotel is relaxed yet elegant. Check-in and check-out were quick, and the room was spacious enough for a small family.

Overall, a solid stay with a few minor areas for improvement. Would definitely consider coming back!

From the moment I arrived, I was enchanted by this hotel. The grounds are simply stunning, a lush green paradise that feels like a tranquil escape from the world. Every corner is meticulously maintained, with vibrant gardens and towering trees creating a serene and beautiful atmosphere. It was a true pleasure to stroll through the pathways, and the constant presence of nature made the entire stay feel incredibly rejuvenating.

I must also extend a special thank you to Tia at the front desk. Her warm and welcoming demeanor made check-in a breeze. She was incredibly helpful throughout my stay, always ready with a smile and excellent recommendations. Her professionalism and genuine kindness are a true asset to the hotel, and she made a significant positive impact on my experience.

This hotel is a perfect choice for anyone seeking beauty, tranquility, and exceptional service. I can't wait to return to this green oasis Royal Orchid in middle of Bangalore City

The hotel itself is elegant, peaceful, and professionally run. Rooms are comfortable, the service is quick, and the staff are polite and attentive. It's an ideal spot for both business travelers and families.

Highly recommended. Will definitely return.

text.text:
Check in time is 1 o clock which is very inconvenient.

Anyone will come to Bangalore in the early morning time so there must be is lot to check in it around 6 o'clock in the morning..

The Person sitting in the reception by name Momtajul does not even know to talk properly.. he is very rude in talking to customers. He is talking in such a way that he is the boss and customers are his slaves.
He should be terminated or he should be taught the minimum manners. His way of speaking is not at all good.

The management should think seriously about changing of check in time from 1.00 pm to  6 o'clock in the morning.

Many people are vacating at around that time and the rooms are vacant but still they are asking the customers to wait till 1 o'clock because the room cleaning people will come at 10 o'clock...
If the same thing continues for some more time, you will be losing the business and regular customers.

If it is needed you can please ask the housekeeping people to come at 6 o'clock, clean the vacated rooms and go so that checking can be given in the morning time itself so that customers will not face trouble.

If you want you can charge extra but provide the service.. but don't keep one useless fellow in the reception and make him speak whatever comes to his mouth.

Or please provide the management numbers across the counter so that we can escalate the thing to the higher authorities then and there itself..

Room : no water to drink, intercom did not work had to go down from 3rd floor just to find no one in the reception.
The Cot in the room has sharp edges which hurt my leg. Pillow not clean, may be used one.
Never will I stay in the hotel nor will I recommend anyone.

text.text:
Stayed here last night booking ID - 2Z890SRB for reference purpose for the Hotel Management Team to verify and overall, the experience was disappointing — with one major exception: the breakfast.

Melange Restaurant served a genuinely enjoyable breakfast. The selection was decent, but the French toast stood out — perfectly cooked, lightly crisped, and absolutely delicious. It was the only part of the stay that felt like it belonged in a higher-rated hotel.

Unfortunately, everything else fell flat. The rooms were shockingly small, barely enough space to walk around the bed as compared to it was priced at.

Worse still, the air-conditioning was a nightmare. The room remained uncomfortably warm and stuffy throughout my stay, with no proper airflow. To make matters worse, the temperature setting couldn’t be reduced below 21°C, which made it almost suffocating and unable to sleep the whole night.

This hotel might work if you’re just dropping by for breakfast lunch or dinner, but I wouldn’t recommend it for a stay. The great French toast just doesn’t make up for the lack of basic comfort in the rooms.

text.text:
My husband and I stayed here 3X for business most of the time, and the last visit was business/vacation.

We normally arrive very early in the morning, and the reception staff has always been accommodating, offering our requests such as early breakfast or late evening meals.

The room was always clean and inviting, making for a great stay. The housekeeping staff was always attentive to cleaning necessary things upon daily cleaning and even very helpful with laundry. They even extended their service when we found out one of the t-shirts was stained, and they offered to fix it and even offered our free laundry service. We also went to their spa, restaurants, gym, and pool.

Overall, we are very pleased with the excellent hospitality of the staff in any department. Thus, whenever we have a business trip, we always choose/book the Radisson Blu Hotel.

Happy to recommend it not only for business but also for vacation.

text.text:
Rude chef and Cold Management - helpful staff.

Pleasant First: (Some slip between the cup and lip is fine)

The front office team was extremely prompt in addressing the challenges that I had and acted upon them swiftly. (Though critical expectations were shared much prior to arrival). Was courteous and quick.
The F&B Operation team was good and swift. They displayed a courteous approach.
Housekeeping was great; they maintained the room well and in order. (With the given limitation and property age)
Tea and coffee are well-made at breakfast, and the chef at the live kitchen making dosa is very courteous and empathetic.

Some Unpleasant ones: (Undesirable and unexpected from the hospitality standpoint)

The Executive chef was extremely rude and loud. Not only did he misbehave in front of the guest and the staff in the restaurant, but he was also aggressive and almost charged at me. What if he had hit me! He was unapologetic and unempathetic. The staff present there agreed to his misdemeanour and were surprised.
It’s a safety issue; a mentally unstable person is dangerous.
The bone of contention was that I demanded no or extremely low salt food – I am on a dietary restriction and couldn’t have gobhi paratha on 9th July last day of my stay. (There was no proper alternative in the buffet on the same day) I requested Aloo Paratha, believing that it would be low on salt, as in the past 02 days it was, and normally in a 4/5 star hotel, one does not have to worry about the excess salt. However, Paratha came with more salt, which I brought to the restaurant manager's attention, who directed me to the executive chef.
He offered a chance to serve something else. We agreed upon Poha. I believed that the chef knows my salt threshold and will make the poha suitably. However, Poha came late and with high salt. Upon complaining about this to the chef, he got extremely hyper and was loud to convince me that I had a problem, and the salt was a generous amount. Well, this makes no sense when one is aware of the expectation of the guest.
The upma served the previous day on the cheffing dish was hard and was not well kept. I informed the chef about the same, too.
The restaurant is an open space with greenery around, bound to have fruit flies. The Cut Fruits and Sprouts were kept open on the counter, attracting flies. When you have a croissant in a closed lid, why were Fruits, Sprouts and Muffins kept open?
On arrival, the room was not blocked as per the shared expectation. The room booked was a corner room with a window facing the road, and it was a lot noisier. They shifted to another room, which also had a lot of noise, and were shifted to the third room, which was a smoking room(I had asked for a non-smoking room), but it was quiet and had no sipage smell, so I was fine to use it for that night. I was tired and had no energy after shifting 03 rooms. Apparently, the hotel didn’t have any other rooms.

text.text:
ITC Gardenia, Bangalore, is the epitome of luxury and elegance. From the moment you step in, you’re greeted with exceptional hospitality—every staff member, from the security team to the managers, is warm, courteous, and professional. The rooms are beautifully designed, spacious, and offer a stunning view from the balcony that truly elevates the experience.

The complimentary breakfast is a highlight—an elaborate spread featuring a wide variety of Indian and international dishes, all delicious and served in a lovely setting. Staying guests also get a 20% discount on other meals and liquor, which is a great bonus considering the top-notch quality of the food and beverages.

What truly sets ITC Gardenia apart is the flawless service and deeply ingrained culture of hospitality. Every detail is thoughtfully taken care of, making your stay feel special and indulgent. It’s absolutely worth every penny for the luxury, comfort, and experience you receive. And if you’re lucky, you might even catch some great offers. Highly recommended for both business and leisure stays!

text.text:
If possible would have given -10 rating. Most pathetic and indecent hotel. They claim that they are 3 star hotel but in reality they are worse than a basic lodge. The staff is highly unprofessional and ill mannered.

If you are going there with an online booking,
they will simply mistreat you and will not give you the Rooms stating that they don’t have any rooms available at the moment. Or they will simply ask you to cancel your online booking and book their hotel rooms via offline mode just to save the taxes. Or they will make you wait up till the check in time even when you request for early check in and ready to pay the extra charges just because you are travelling with your family and everyone is exhausted.

At the reception only, you will get the negative vibes that something is not right and they are simply taking the advantage of outside travellers those who are completely unfamiliar with the surroundings.

This kind of malpractice and unprofessional behaviour is highly unacceptable hence I will never recommended anyone to book the rooms at such pathetic hotels. 🙏🙏

editorialSummary.text: Chic suites with kitchenettes in an upmarket hotel offering a restaurant & a poolside bar.

text.text: I've been at this hotel for a week and I'm having a great experience. The breakfast food in the hotel restaurant is perfect. It has options for every taste, and everything is fresh and well-prepared. Some items are made to order, like eggs and some traditional Indian dishes, and the coffee is also made to order, even though it's all part of the buffet. I had my birthday this week, and everyone treated me extra special. The rooms are quiet—I'm on the first floor, and yet we didn't hear anything from outside. The street outside the hotel is also quiet. The bed is large and comfortable, the mattress is hard, but perfect. I also drank the water provided in the rooms, and had no problems at all. Overall, a great experience. I recommend it.

text.text:
I had the most delightful stay at Hotel Grand Mercure, a true gem of luxury and warmth! The staff’s infectious positivity and genuine kindness made every moment special—from the warm welcome at check-in to the attentive service throughout my stay. Their smiles and eagerness to assist created an atmosphere of pure joy, making me feel like royalty.
The culinary experience was exceptional, with an array of healthy, flavorful dishes that were as nourishing as they were delicious. Fresh, vibrant ingredients shone in every meal, from crisp salads to wholesome entrees, all beautifully presented and bursting with taste. The chefs clearly prioritize quality and wellness, catering to every palate with finesse.
What truly elevated the experience was the enchanting fragrance that enveloped the entire premises. A subtle, refreshing scent of citrus and florals lingered in the air, from the elegant lobby to the serene corridors, creating a calming and luxurious ambiance that was simply divine.
Every detail at Hotel Grand Mercure exudes sophistication, but it’s the cheerful staff, wholesome cuisine, and captivating fragrance that make this hotel an unforgettable haven. I can’t wait to return!

text.text:
BLR Pods – A Surprisingly Cozy and Secure Stay!

At first glance, I imagined BLR Pods to be a basic dorm-style setup—perhaps an open hall with closely placed cots and minimal privacy. But stepping inside, that expectation was instantly flipped. Each pod is a compact sanctuary, thoughtfully designed with full control over air conditioning, mood lighting, and reading lights. Whether you're choosing single or twin sharing, even the single pods offer plenty of space to sleep comfortably without feeling cramped.

The restrooms are well-maintained, and the facility includes a separate office space that’s perfect for remote work or meetings.

🍽️ Step outside and you’ll find a variety of breakfast spots, local eateries, and restaurants within walking distance—great for both early risers and foodies.

🔐 They’ve also provided individual lockers for guests and a highly secure access system using entry cards, which adds peace of mind to the overall experience.

A big thanks to BLR Pods for offering such a well-balanced mix of convenience, comfort, and security. This stay truly redefined my expectations!

If you are looking for budget friendly and looking to crash for a night. this is go to place for budget friendly travellers.

text.text:
We had a good overall stay, though a few things could’ve been better. The rooms, while compact, were clean, well-maintained, and offered a beautiful view of Haridwar - ideal for a business/solo stay. The shower area was surprisingly spacious, though I wasn’t a fan of the toilet and washbasin being combined. Still, it served the purpose well!!

A special shoutout to the Duty Manager from the Front Office who spoke to me before check-in; he was extremely kind and thoughtful. Since I had booked the stay as a surprise weekend getaway for my sister after a long work week, he arranged for a lovely handwritten note and a small pastry cake in the room. That personal touch truly made our arrival feel special!!!!

The gym and pool were great although we wish we had the time to use them!! At the restaurant, the service team was extremely hospitable - staff like Nandini and one more girl whose name I forgot were warm and friendly, and it made breakfast enjoyable. But, this was slightly marred when Subhash interrupted our chat and called them away abruptly, citing “work,” which felt unnecessary and unprofessional - brief interactions with guests should be welcomed, not shut down!!

The breakfast had an impressive spread of South Indian dishes, which were delicious. However, the bread section was a letdown - items like the toast, croissants, danish pastries, donuts, pancakes, waffles, and French toast lacked freshness and texture. I do hope they improve this area as they host more than just Indian guests. The chef was kind enough to check in and offer alternatives, which we appreciated!!!

One area that truly fell short was the handling of my late checkout request. The Front Office Manager Mr. Mallik said he would check and get back to us reg our request while he was checking us in the late evening, but never followed up. When I ran into him the next morning at the lobby, he didn’t acknowledge me at all or provide an answer - something as simple as a “yes” or “no” would have sufficed. That lack of basic courtesy was disappointing!!!

Despite these hiccups, the overall vibe of the hotel was good. With a few improvements in professionalism and breakfast variety, it could easily move from “good” to “great.” It’s a nice spot for solo travelers - whether for a short trip or an extended work stay!!!!

text.text:
Our stay at Vivanta, Residency Road, Bangalore, was extremely disappointing and far from the standards we expect from the Taj group.

1.	Poor Technical Support – The technicians had absolutely no knowledge of how to connect the WiFi or resolve the TV issues. We spent over two hours with continuous disturbance from the technician, only to eventually resolve the issue on our own. The Samsung Android TV provided in the room seems to be just for show.
2.	Substandard Amenities – The bathroom amenities were shocking for a Taj property. They provided cheap ₹5 soaps instead of a proper handwash bottle. Even after multiple requests, they didn’t provide handwash and instead sent more small soaps.
3.	Unresponsive Reception – Nobody answers calls at the reception, making even basic communication a hassle.
4.	Delayed Room Service – Any food order takes over 45 minutes to arrive, which is highly inconvenient.
5.	Overall Service Experience – The service quality is far below Taj standards. From the very first day, the experience was pathetic, stressful, and disappointing. Despite paying for 8 days upfront, the first day itself left us dissatisfied and regretful of our choice.

We had high expectations from Taj, but our experience at Vivanta, Residency Road, has been extremely disappointing. I would not recommend this property to anyone.

⸻

text.text:
I paid ₹9,000 for two nights, and choosing this hotel was the worst decision of my life. First, their team lacks coordination—one staff member agreed to an early check-in, while another denied it. Then, they asked us to compromise on the AC, which wasn’t working, and offered a table fan instead. Is this what we paid ₹9,000 for?

The room was not ready even after a five-hour wait. The shower tap, TV, and room controller were all non-functional, and when we called for assistance, the response was extremely delayed. Basic amenities like plates were not provided, which should be standard in any hotel room.

When we requested a room change because the AC wasn’t cooling, the receptionist completely ignored our request. I would not recommend anyone to waste their money on such a terrible hotel.

The Leela Palace Bengaluru is an extraordinary blend of opulence and modernity, truly living up to its reputation as Garden City’s only modern palace hotel. From the moment you arrive, you’re greeted by an ambiance of grandeur and elegance, with stunning architecture and lush greenery that make you feel like royalty.

The rooms are impeccably designed, combining modern comforts with regal charm. Every detail, from the plush furnishings to the luxurious amenities, reflects unparalleled attention to quality and guest satisfaction.

Dining at The Leela Palace is a feast for the senses. The restaurants offer an exceptional variety of cuisines, each crafted to perfection. Whether it’s an indulgent breakfast spread or a fine-dining experience, the culinary standards are simply world-class.

The serene gardens, tranquil pool, and indulgent spa provide a perfect escape from the bustling city, making it a haven of relaxation. The service is outstanding – every staff member goes above and beyond to ensure your stay is nothing short of perfect.

For those seeking luxury, comfort, and a touch of royalty in the heart of Bengaluru, The Leela Palace is truly unmatched. An unforgettable experience.

text.text:
I recently had the pleasure of staying at The Leela Palace Bangalore, and it was an unforgettable experience from start to finish. This hotel epitomizes luxury, offering a perfect blend of opulence, great cuisine, and exceptional service.

The moment I stepped into the hotel, I was captivated by its elegant and sophisticated decor. The rooms are beautifully designed with high-end furnishings and modern amenities, ensuring maximum comfort and relaxation. The attention to detail in the design and the cleanliness of the property is truly impressive. To think that a property as old as this is maintained so well is commendable.

The food is nothing short of spectacular. The diverse menu features a wide array of delectable dishes, each prepared with the finest ingredients. Whether it was the sumptuous breakfast buffet or the in-room dining, every meal was a culinary delight. The presentation and flavors were top-notch, making dining here a memorable experience.

What truly sets The Leela Palace apart is the outstanding service. The staff is incredibly attentive, professional, and friendly. From the warm welcome at check-in to the personalized attention throughout my stay, every interaction was marked by genuine hospitality. The team went above and beyond to ensure that all my needs were met, including extending my check-out as much as possible and that I felt pampered throughout my visit.

I highly recommend this hotel and look forward to returning in the future.

text.text:
Fantastic Stay with Exceptional Service

I had a wonderful stay at Ibis Bangalore City Centre. The hotel is clean, bright, and pet-friendly—Bailey had a great time! The highlight of our experience was the excellent service from Concierge Prakash, warn and welcoming. who is from Mangalore. It felt amazing to be able to converse in Tulu with him, which made our stay even more special.

The hotel provided interconnecting rooms for our family, which was a fantastic convenience. Sudhiram from housekeeping ensured that our rooms were spotless and well-maintained throughout our stay. Very detail oriented and patient.

The kitchen provided us with delicious food and not only for us but bailey got a beautifully plated dinner made by the chef. (It was dog friendly)

Overall, the warm hospitality and attention to detail made our stay truly enjoyable. Highly recommend this hotel for anyone visiting Bangalore!

text.text:
My stay at Holiday Inn, Racecourse was fantastic. The hotel's location was perfect, overlooking the Race Course and surrounded by lots of trees.

The rooms and service were top-notch, just like you'd expect from this hotel chain. I asked for a specific room that I'd stayed in before, and the staff I talked to at the hotel's call desk was really helpful. They made sure I got the room I wanted, which was a nice touch.

I want to give a shout-out to a few people who made my stay even better. The buffet breakfast at Cafe G was delicious, and the staff there were so dedicated. The chef even remembered how I liked my mini-pancakes, which was a nice surprise.

The front door staff were really helpful too. They took care of my luggage and had it ready for me when I needed it. Braison at the front desk was super helpful with my reservations and remembered all my room preferences.

Even though no one escorted me to my room, it was okay because it was a busy day. But Aman from Cafe G and Sahid from Housekeeping went out of their way to make me feel welcome. They were both friendly and helpful.

I also want to mention Prasanjit and Nitish from the In-Room Dining Staff. They were both really nice and made sure I had everything I needed during my stay. And the Alfredo Pasta from The In-Room Dining Oriental Box was amazing, it was a special request and I had it every day! And it was one of the reasons I chose this hotel again for my R&R stay.

Overall, my experience at Holiday Inn, Racecourse was great. The beautiful surroundings, excellent service, and tasty food made it a memorable stay. I'll definitely be coming back here for my future trips.

Overall, I would highly recommend the Holiday Inn Bengaluru Racecourse Road to anyone looking for a comfortable and memorable stay in Bangalore. The combination of excellent rooms, delicious food, and outstanding hospitality makes it a truly special place.

Thanks, Akanksha, for making my stay so special!

I will definitely stay here on my next visit to Bangalore.

text.text: The Ritz-Carlton, Bangalore is centrally located in the soul of Bangalore, in close proximity to the finest in shopping, dining and entertainment experiences. Luxuriously decorated with a contemporary art collection, it features complimentary high speed Wi-Fi access, outdoor swimming pool, The Ritz-Carlton Spa and a 24-hour gym. The Ritz-Carlton, Bangalore is a five minutes’ walk from the finest in shopping, dining, cultural and entertainment experiences. In the vicinity of famous hubs such as M.G.Road, UB city, the hotel is located in the heart of Bangalore, in the posh neighborhood of Residency Road. Kempagowda International Airport is 37 Kms from the hotel and is a 45 minutes’ drive from there, during the non-rush hours. Curated experiences like early morning breakfast cycling tours of the city, a foray into traditional looms to witness the intricate weaving of the famed Mysore silk saris by artisans, a day tour to the vineyards for exclusive wine and cheese tasting sessions, or a heritage visit to the Tipu Sultan Summer Palace among others are on offer. The 277 rooms and suites at the hotel offer a spectacular view of the city. Each air-conditioned room comes equipped with a wall-mounted cable TV, walk-in closet and a marble bathroom that includes a deep soaking bath tub and rain shower. Bathrooms are also outfitted with designer toiletries, complimentary toiletries and hairdryers. Rooms also feature a spacious seating area and are equipped with a work desk, flat-screen satellite TV, mini-bar and electric kettle. The private bathrooms feature complimentary Asprey of London bath amenities. Filling the hotel’s entire fifth floor, The Ritz-Carlton Spa, Bangalore offers luxury treatments drawing from Indian and Eastern healing traditions, a salon and swimming pool. Twelve treatment rooms include a VIP suite and two express service rooms. Featuring access facilities for the differently abled, The Ritz-Carlton, Bangalore also has a fitness center, steam and sauna, a business center and a tour desk. Car rental and currency exchange facilities are also on offer. The exclusive Club Lounge located on level 15 allows club guests to enjoy multiple daily culinary presentations, complimentary limousine transfer to the vicinity and unparalleled concierge service. The hotel features of a beautiful setting for dining experiences, with elegant restaurants and bars, namely: • The Lantern – Modern Canton and Dim Sum House • BANG - Rooftop, High Energy Bar • The Market – World Kitchen • Ganache – Patisserie and Delicatessen • The Lobby Lounge. Recommended 👍

text.text:
Unwelcome Treatment: Discrimination at Ritz Carlton Bangalore

Yesterday, I, along with my team of 12, visited Ritz Carlton with high expectations for a delightful dining experience. As a passionate food blogger and traveller, I was eager to capture the essence of The Market restaurant through my lens and share it with my audience. However, what unfolded was nothing short of a disgraceful display of discrimination that left us utterly upset.
Before even setting foot in The Market, we were rudely confronted by an Operations Manager named Jocelyn Vaz. With an air of superiority, he demanded that I switch off my camera and forbade any form of video recording. To add insult to injury, he then instructed his subordinate to monitor our every move, as if we were criminals plotting some wicked act. This humiliating experience was witnessed by my entire team, leaving me insulted in from of my team ad us feeling sidelined and disrespected.
Despite my attempt to address this issue personally with Jocelyn, the damage had already been done. It was only through the intervention of the Restaurant in charge, Mr. Sunil Kumar, that we received an acknowledgment for Jocelyn's inappropriate behaviour. While his apology was appreciated, it hardly compensated for the marked experience we suffered.
The incident at Ritz Carlton made us feel like unwelcome outsiders, unworthy of the same treatment as other guests. No number of regretful words can undo the sense of humiliation and disappointment that overshadowed what should have been a memorable dining experience. We had hoped for a good evening and hospitality, but instead, we were met with discrimination and disregard.

Moving forward, it is with great reluctance that we vow not to visit Ritz Carlton again. Our hard-earned money and loyalty deserve to be appreciated, not met with prejudice and hostility. It's disheartening to see such behaviour tolerated in a renowned establishment like Ritz Carlton.

I've had the opportunity to travel extensively and experience hospitality from some of the world's finest establishments, including Taj, Leela, The Oberoi, ITC, Four Seasons, and many others. Never have I encountered such disrespectful treatment. Even at 3-star and 4-star hotels where I've been personally invited, I've been greeted warmly, served by chefs, and offered premium accommodations with breathtaking views for me and my family. Unfortunately, the damage has been done, and this negative experience at Ritz Carlton stands out starkly against the backdrop of exceptional hospitality I've enjoyed elsewhere.

I must take a moment to express my gratitude to Miss Rajshree Buragohain for her efforts in arranging our space and providing exceptional service. Thank you, Rajshree.

Luxuriously decorated with a contemporary art collection, it features complimentary high speed Wi-Fi access, outdoor swimming pool, The Ritz-Carlton Spa and a 24-hour gym. The Ritz-Carlton, Bangalore is a five minutes’ walk from the finest in shopping, dining, cultural and entertainment experiences. In the vicinity of famous hubs such as M.G.Road, UB city, the hotel is located in the heart of Bangalore, in the posh neighborhood of Residency Road. Kempagowda International Airport is 37 Kms from the hotel and is a 45 minutes’ drive from there, during the non-rush hours. Curated experiences like early morning breakfast cycling tours of the city, a foray into traditional looms to witness the intricate weaving of the famed Mysore silk saris by artisans, a day tour to the vineyards for exclusive wine and cheese tasting sessions, or a heritage visit to the Tipu Sultan Summer Palace among others are on offer. The 277 rooms and suites at the hotel offer a spectacular view of the city. Each air-conditioned room comes equipped with a wall-mounted cable TV, walk-in closet and a marble bathroom that includes a deep soaking bath tub and rain shower. Bathrooms are also outfitted with designer toiletries, complimentary toiletries and hairdryers. Rooms also feature a spacious seating area and are equipped with a work desk, flat-screen satellite TV, mini-bar and electric kettle. The private bathrooms feature complimentary Asprey of London bath amenities. Filling the hotel’s entire fifth floor, The Ritz-Carlton Spa, Bangalore offers luxury treatments drawing from Indian and Eastern healing traditions, a salon and swimming pool. Twelve treatment rooms include a VIP suite and two express service rooms. Featuring access facilities for the differently abled, The Ritz-Carlton, Bangalore also has a fitness center, steam and sauna, a business center and a tour desk. Car rental and currency exchange facilities are also on offer. The exclusive Club Lounge located on level 15 allows club guests to enjoy multiple daily culinary presentations, complimentary limousine transfer to the vicinity and unparalleled concierge service. The hotel features of a beautiful setting for dining experiences, with elegant restaurants and bars, namely: • The Lantern – Modern Canton and Dim Sum House • BANG - Rooftop, High Energy Bar • The Market – World Kitchen • Ganache – Patisserie and Delicatessen • The Lobby Lounge. Recommended 👍

text.text:
We stayed at Hotel Royal Orchid in a Deluxe King Size Room from June 21 to July 4 as a family with a child, and had a really enjoyable experience.

The staff were friendly and helpful, especially when it came to housekeeping — the room could’ve been a bit cleaner at first, but they responded quickly and took care of it when asked. The hotel amenities were great and added a lot to our stay, especially with a kid — everything felt safe, comfortable, and well-managed.

Dining was excellent — good variety, tasty food, and smooth service. The location is convenient, and the overall vibe of the hotel is relaxed yet elegant. Check-in and check-out were quick, and the room was spacious enough for a small family.

Overall, a solid stay with a few minor areas for improvement. Would definitely consider coming back!

text.text:
Review for Hotel Himalaya Monarch, Bangalore

I had a wonderful stay at Hotel Himalaya Monarch in Bangalore. The hospitality was exceptional, and the staff went above and beyond to ensure our comfort.

A special shoutout to Suraj, who was always prompt and attentive, making sure all our requests were met with a smile. Hussein was incredibly helpful and courteous, ensuring our check-in and check-out process was seamless. Harishchandra, on the other hand, impressed us with his professionalism and attention to detail, especially in handling our room service needs.

The hotel is well-maintained, with clean and spacious rooms, a convenient location, and a cozy ambiance. The food was delicious, and the staff's dedication truly elevated our experience.

I would highly recommend Hotel Himalaya Monarch to anyone visiting Bangalore. A big thank you to the entire team for making our stay memorable!

text.text:
My family and I had an amazing stay at the Radisson Blu Bengaluru Outer Ring Road from July 3rd to 6th. Traveling with a 1-and-a-half-year-old baby can be challenging, but the exceptional service and attentiveness of the hotel staff made our experience truly delightful. This is the first trip abroad with our baby and I must especially mention the exceptional service of Tamanna who went out of her way to help us out during out stay. We really fell in love with this hotel mainly for ALL the staff here. They were all amazing from the check-in time (Very early in the morning around 4AM- they were all enthusiastic and so friendly)

From the moment we arrived, the staff went out of their way to ensure we were comfortable. The hotel and restaurant staff even arranged baby-friendly meals, which was thoughtful. The room was spacious, clean, and had all the amenities we needed. They made sure the hotel kept it clean all the time and very friendly.

The hotel's facilities were top-notch. We enjoyed the delicious breakfast buffet every morning, which had a wide variety of options to suit every palate. Buffet had a good selection of food and it was very tasty. The pool area was clean and well-maintained, providing a perfect spot to relax.

What stood out the most was the staff's genuine care and willingness to assist us at every turn. Whether it was helping with our luggage, providing extra towels, or simply offering a warm smile, they made us feel at home.

I highly recommend Radisson Blu Bengaluru Outer Ring Road for anyone looking for a comfortable and memorable stay, especially families with young children. We are grateful for the hospitality and look forward to returning in the future. I will go as far as to say, next time I come to Bengaluru, I will not think twice to book Radisson Blu Bengaluru Outer Ring Road.

text.text:
Stayed here for a week on a business trip. I had a really good time here. The rooms are top notch, spacious with very comfortable bedding. There's a 24/7 gym with a decent variety in machines.
I really enjoyed the breakfast spread. The staff were attentive and the food was delicious. I particularly enjoyed the omelette and dosa live counters.
I also availed the office transfers offered by the hotel. The concierge was very well organised, and I was quite happy with the hotel cabs.

All in all, this is a great hotel, well suited for business purposes.

text.text:
My recent stay at the Royal Orchid Central in Bengaluru offered a delightful experience marked by several commendable aspects. The hotel's prime location in the city center is a significant advantage, providing easy access to local attractions and business hubs. This is particularly beneficial for business travelers or tourists looking to explore Bengaluru.

The ambiance of the hotel is both elegant and comfortable, with tastefully decorated interiors that blend modernity and warmth. The rooms are spacious, offering a pleasant and relaxing environment. The cleanliness and maintenance of the hotel are noteworthy, reflecting their commitment to high standards.

The hotel staff deserves special mention for their professionalism and hospitality. They were attentive, courteous, and went out of their way to ensure a comfortable stay. The quality of service provided was exceptional, contributing significantly to the overall positive experience.

The dining options at the hotel were impressive, with a variety of cuisines that catered to different tastes. The food was delicious, well-prepared, and presented, making each meal a delightful experience.

However, it's important to note a significant issue that occurred during my stay. On one of the nights, the air conditioning in my room was not functioning properly. This led to some discomfort, which was a setback in an otherwise flawless service experience. Although the staff responded to the issue, it is an area that requires attention to prevent future occurrences.

In conclusion, Royal Orchid Central Bengaluru is a commendable choice for anyone seeking quality accommodation in the city. Its strengths in location, ambiance, service, and dining are noteworthy. The issue with the air conditioning was a minor glitch in an otherwise excellent stay. I would recommend this hotel to others, keeping in mind the singular issue I faced.

text.text: A beautiful, centrally located,  walkable hotel with top-class amenities, superb staff, and atmosphere.  I would stay nowhere else but ITC Gardenia when in Bangalore.

originalText.text: A beautiful, centrally located,  walkable hotel with top-class amenities, superb staff, and atmosphere.  I would stay nowhere else but ITC Gardenia when in Bangalore.

text.text:
ITC Gardenia, Bangalore, is the epitome of luxury and elegance. From the moment you step in, you’re greeted with exceptional hospitality—every staff member, from the security team to the managers, is warm, courteous, and professional. The rooms are beautifully designed, spacious, and offer a stunning view from the balcony that truly elevates the experience.

The complimentary breakfast is a highlight—an elaborate spread featuring a wide variety of Indian and international dishes, all delicious and served in a lovely setting. Staying guests also get a 20% discount on other meals and liquor, which is a great bonus considering the top-notch quality of the food and beverages.

What truly sets ITC Gardenia apart is the flawless service and deeply ingrained culture of hospitality. Every detail is thoughtfully taken care of, making your stay feel special and indulgent. It’s absolutely worth every penny for the luxury, comfort, and experience you receive. And if you’re lucky, you might even catch some great offers. Highly recommended for both business and leisure stays!

text.text:
ITC Gardenia has always been close to my heart as I’ve been visiting since childhood, and the garden-themed design beautifully captures the essence of Bangalore. As a local, we’ve often chosen this place to celebrate birthdays and special occasions.
I still remember many of mine here! Trust me, when I say this is a truly special property, I mean it. The property is stunning, the rooms are elegant, and the food is as amazing as everyone says.

During my recent stay, there was a slight hiccup at check-in—the reception team wasn’t as attentive, and the process was delayed. However, once the message reached them, they promptly stepped in and completely turned the situation around with warmth and professionalism, which truly won my heart.

The rooms are elegant, the ambience is serene, and the overall hospitality is exceptional. If you’re visiting Bangalore and are looking for a stay that blends luxury with a deep local touch, ITC Gardenia is absolutely worth considering.

One small gesture that stood out: when I mentioned that a food portion felt a bit small, they sent me an extra serving complimentary. It’s this level of care that makes the experience memorable.

Overall, it’s a property I’ll always recommend—for its hospitality, charm, and deep connection to the spirit of the city.

I stayed at The Signature Inn recently and had a mixed experience. The rooms were clean, comfortable, and well-maintained, which was a positive aspect of my
stay. However, the customer service was extremely disappointing. The reception manager was very rude and unprofessional, which made interactions unpleasant and stressful. The overall customer service needs significant improvement to match the quality of the rooms. I hope the management addresses these issues to enhance the guest experience.

text.text: To be honest, I initially chose this hotel based solely on its star rating without checking the reviews. However, upon reading the reviews, I began to doubt my decision. Additionally, some auto drivers at the station warned me about its location, citing a wine shop and bar right across from it. Despite these concerns, I found the place to be quite pleasant, safe, and overall good. The rooms were impeccably maintained, which was a definite highlight. One of the best aspects is its convenient accessibility from KSR Station, Majestic Bus stand, and the metro – all within walking distance. Moreover, the area is surrounded by decent restaurants. The only downside was the check-in timing. Since I arrived early, I couldn't check in early due to all the rooms being occupied. This resulted in me having to find another hotel to stay in temporarily during that time.

text.text: Wow! What a little hidden gem!! I loved everything about this hotel! First off the beds were wonderful and comfy! Room was nice size and clean. Internet worked great. Good size tv. text.text:
I had an amazing time at the Grand Mercure Hotel Koramangala! From the moment I arrived, I was greeted with such warmth and then whisked away to the beautifully designed rooms that felt like a luxurious home away from home. The views of the lush greenery were breathtaking. The rooms were equipped with all the modern amenities for ultimate comfort and relaxation, and the peaceful atmosphere made it a perfect staycation.

The entire booking process was so easily managed by Pallavi and the entire team ensured to make our stay was comfortable and memorable.

The housekeeping team ensured that my room was spotless and well-stocked with amenities every day, which added greatly to the comfort of my stay.

The restaurant service at the hotel was also top-notch, they were attentive provided excellent recommendations for drinks, and ensured that every meal was served promptly and presented beautifully. Breakfast at the hotel was delicious, offering a diverse selection of dishes, each prepared to perfection. The Alfresco coffee shop is my favorite place; a serene atmosphere to sit all day.

Kudos to the team: Devika, Tukuna, Abhishek, Akshara, and Braj Kishor
I recommend this place to anyone looking for a luxurious feel and a peaceful getaway!

text.text:
Memorable Birthday Celebration at Grand Mercure Koramangala!

We had an amazing experience at Grand Mercure Koramangala, and I’d like to especially thank Manager Parag for making our stay truly memorable. From the moment we arrived, the hospitality was exceptional. Parag personally welcomed us and informed us that they would be arranging a special birthday celebration — and they did not disappoint! A special mention to Praduman, the Duty Manager, for his prompt response and for sharing all the necessary information with great patience and clarity.

They went out of their way to make the day feel special. My wife was warmly welcomed with a thoughtful gift of chocolates, and the staff surprised us with a beautiful birthday setup that made the moment even more joyful.

The hotel itself is classy, clean, and comfortable, but it’s the warm service and personal touches that really set it apart. A heartfelt thank you to Manager Parag and the entire team for making our celebration so special. We truly appreciate the effort and would highly recommend Grand Mercure Koramangala to anyone looking for a stay with a personal and luxurious touch!

text.text: I had an excellent experience staying at this hotel in Bangalore. The service was top-notch—every request I made to guest services was handled promptly, and the staff were always super attentive. The hotel’s location is fantastic—it’s in a great area for walking around, with lots of restaurants and nightlife nearby, yet it still feels peaceful. One thing I particularly enjoyed was the food: the restaurant’s dishes were always delicious. Even if you got tired of the buffet options, they had an excellent à la carte menu, and the chef always prepared everything to perfection. Overall, I’d definitely recommend it!

text.text:
I recently had the pleasure of staying at the Radisson Blu Centre City, and I must say, it exceeded my expectations in every way. As a seasoned traveler, I've had my fair share of hotel experiences, but this one truly stood out.

From the moment I stepped into the lobby, I was greeted with warm smiles and impeccable service. The staff were attentive, efficient, and went above and beyond to ensure my stay was nothing short of exceptional.

The room was tastefully decorated, with a perfect blend of modern amenities and comfortable furnishings. The bed was plush, the bathroom was spotless, and the views of the city were simply stunning.

One of the highlights of my stay was the hotel's commitment to sustainability. From the eco-friendly toiletries to the energy-efficient lighting, it was clear that the Radisson Blu Centre City is dedicated to reducing its environmental footprint.

The hotel's location is also worth mentioning. Situated in the heart of the city, it's within walking distance to many popular attractions, restaurants, and shops.

In conclusion, my stay at the Radisson Blu Centre City was truly unforgettable. With its exceptional hospitality, comfortable accommodations, and commitment to sustainability, I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone looking for a top-notch experience in the city.

text.text:
Vivanta Bangalore offers an exceptional experience that is truly a blend of luxury, comfort, and impeccable service. From the moment you step into the lobby, you are greeted with warmth and hospitality that sets the tone for your stay. The rooms are elegantly designed, spacious, and equipped with modern amenities that make your stay comfortable and relaxing.

One of the highlights is the dining experience – the restaurants serve an impressive variety of cuisines, each dish meticulously prepared to cater to every palate. The breakfast spread is particularly noteworthy, with a range of options that leave you spoilt for choice.

The staff at Vivanta Bangalore go above and beyond to ensure that every guest feels valued, providing prompt and courteous service. The location of the hotel is also excellent, offering easy access to many of the city's attractions.

Whether you're traveling for business or leisure, Vivanta Bangalore promises an outstanding stay. It’s truly a haven of luxury in the heart of the city, and I can’t recommend it highly enough.

text.text:
Exceptional Stay Experience at Vivanta by Taj, Bangalore.Residency road

Dear Team,
I wanted to take a moment to express my heartfelt appreciation for the exceptional service and a memorable stay my family and I experienced during our visit to Bangalore from July 7th to July 11th.

From the moment we arrived, we were warmly welcomed by your attentive staff, who went above and beyond to ensure our comfort. The check-in process was smooth, and our room was beautifully appointed, providing a perfect oasis to relax after our busy days exploring the city.

The Breakfast buffet dining experience was outstanding and loved the lay out and the variety. Each meal was a delightful journey of flavors, and the staff’s recommendations were spot on. We especially loved Ragi Dosa and the morning bakery items.

What truly stood out was the personalized service of Restaurant Manager Sandip Singha and floor HK supervisor Suresh/ Rujula. Every staff member we encountered was friendly, professional, and eager to assist, making us feel valued throughout our stay.

Thank you once again for making our visit to Bangalore so special. We look forward to returning to Vivanta by Taj on our next trip!

Warm regards,

Sonali Vinod
GM Clarks Inn
Lucknow.

text.text:
Nestled in the heart of Bangalore, the Radisson Blu Hotel provides a splendid retreat, seamlessly blending modern luxury with warm hospitality. From the moment you enter, you are greeted by an inviting ambiance and an attentive staff dedicated to ensuring an exceptional experience. The rooms are elegantly appointed, featuring contemporary decor and thoughtful amenities that cater to both business and leisure travelers.
The hotel's dining options are noteworthy, offering a delightful array of culinary experiences—from exquisite local dishes to international fare—all beautifully presented and expertly prepared. The spacious, well-equipped fitness center and serene spa provide opportunities for relaxation and rejuvenation, allowing guests to unwind after a busy day.

In addition, the Radisson's strategic location makes it an ideal base for exploring Bangalore’s vibrant culture and bustling business districts. Overall, the Radisson Blu Bangalore stands as a beacon of comfort and sophistication in the city, making it a top choice for discerning travelers seeking a memorable stay. Highly recommended!

text.text:
4-star hotel located in the heart of Bangalore. It is a short walk from the MG Road commercial district and the Cubbon Park. The rooms are spacious and well-appointed, with all the amenities you would expect from a 4-star hotel. The hotel has a number of facilities, including a swimming pool, a fitness center, a spa, and a business center. There are also three restaurants on-site, serving Indian, Continental, and Italian cuisine. The hotel's location is one of its biggest strengths. It is close to all the major attractions in Bangalore, and it is also well-connected to the rest of the city by public transportation.
The staff at the hotel are friendly and helpful. Overall, the Radisson Blu Atria Bengaluru is a good hotel for business or leisure travelers. It is well-located, has modern amenities, and offers excellent service.
Overall, the Radisson Blu Atria Bengaluru is a good hotel

text.text:
The Lalit Ashok Bengaluru is a 5-star hotel located in the heart of Bangalore, India. It is a luxurious hotel that is perfect for business and leisure travelers alike. The hotel has a variety of amenities, including a swimming pool, spa, fitness center, and several restaurants. The rooms are spacious and well-appointed, and the staff is friendly and helpful. The hotel is also located close to many of Bangalore's attractions, making it a great place to stay if you want to explore the city.

Pros:

Luxurious accommodations

Friendly and helpful staff

Convenient location

Variety of amenities

Excellent service

Cons:

Some guests have found the hotel to be noisy

The hotel is a bit on the expensive side

Overall, I highly recommend The Lalit Ashok Bengaluru to anyone looking for a luxurious and convenient hotel in Bangalore.

Here are some specific details about my stay at The Lalit Ashok Bengaluru:

Check-in:

Check-in was quick and easy. The staff was friendly and helpful and made me feel welcome.

Room:

I stayed in a Premier Double Room with Pool View. The room was spacious and well-appointed. The bed was comfortable, and the bathroom was clean and spacious. I also enjoyed the view of the pool from my balcony.

Amenities:

The hotel has a variety of amenities, including a swimming pool, spa, fitness center, and several restaurants. I used the swimming pool and spa, and both were excellent. The spa is especially nice, and I recommend getting a massage if you have time.

Dining:

I ate at the hotel's restaurant, The Market Place, for breakfast. The breakfast buffet was excellent, and there was a wide variety of food to choose from. I also had dinner at the hotel's restaurant, The Belvedere. The food was delicious, and the service was excellent.

Service:

The staff at The Lalit Ashok Bengaluru is friendly and helpful. They were always willing to go the extra mile to make my stay comfortable.

Location:

The hotel is located in the heart of Bangalore, close to many of the city's attractions. I was able to walk to many of the places I wanted to visit, which was a big plus.

Overall, I had a great stay at The Lalit Ashok Bengaluru. The hotel is luxurious, convenient, and has excellent service. I would definitely stay here again if I am ever in Bangalore.

I hope this review is helpful. If you have any questions, please feel free to ask.

Overall, I had a great stay at The Lalit Ashok Bengaluru. The hotel is luxurious, convenient, and has excellent service. I would definitely stay here again if I am ever in Bangalore.

I hope this review is helpful. If you have any questions, please feel free to ask.

text.text: During our stay from Jan 6-8, 2025, the staff consistently demonstrated exceptional manners and professionalism, greatly enhancing our experience. One staff member, Ms.Shabitha, stood out at the reception desk. When we faced a significant delay with our flight, she exemplified what excellent customer service should be. She took the time to listen to our concerns and went above and beyond to ensure we felt supported during this frustrating situation. Ms.Shabitha organized our luggage, swiftly accommodating our needs while providing clear instructions and updates. Her proactive approach made the whole process seamless and stress-free, allowing us to focus on making the best of an inconvenient situation. It was clear that she genuinely cared about our comfort and well-being, and her kindness and efficiency had a lasting impact on our overall experience. Moreover, the restaurant staff members, Mr. Arumugam and Ms. Bumikha, were equally impressive. They greeted us with warm smiles and provided attentive service, ensuring we had everything we needed to enjoy our meals. Their friendliness and dedication further contributed to the welcoming atmosphere of the establishment, making our stay truly memorable. Thank you❤️

text.text: Great location, great hotel, friendly staff and top notch ambiance.

originalText.text: Great location, great hotel, friendly staff and top notch ambiance.

text.text:
The rooms are shabby and show a lack of maintenance. For instance, chest of drawers in the room have handles missing and sharp edges. The windows are single glazed and let in cold air and noise from outside. There is a kettle and fridge in the room, but neither of them worked.
The bathroom had lovely and very striking black and white marble around the sink, but the grouting around the tiling in the rest of the room was grubby. The shower head was suspended above a semi-sunken small bath, when modern showers are in a separate shower cubicle, some with rain-water heads.
There was no hot water.
There were lots of room fresheners hanging all over the bedrooms and corridors. We counted 4 in our bedroom alone. It did make us wonder how awful the rooms would have smelled, without them.
Staff at Reception were extremely unhelpful. We were a party of 6 couples, celebrating a wedding reception in the hotel. We had booked 6 rooms, of which 2 were day rooms, for the bride and other women in the party to use for getting ready. Reception staff seemed to be unable to find all our rooms, especially the day rooms, which just led to extra stress for the wedding party. When the Reception staff finally managed to find the rooms we had booked, they threw a pen and the form across the counter, with a cursory “fill this in”. No “please”.
The entrance to the hotel is stunning, with lots of white marble, and very attractive glass lifts up to the upper floors of the hotel. However, there appeared to be no staircase alongside the lifts, which is unbelievably dangerous in case of fire, and annoying in case of a power cut (of which there were two or three short-lived occurrences during our overnight stay).
The interior décor gave rise to a certain amount of dark humour, as the corridors had a certain fin-de-siécle cruise liner vibe. With Céline Dior’s rendition of “My heart will go on” on a permanent loop on the hotel’s sound system, we felt like we were in the last days of the Titanic.

The swimming pool was closed because of Covid/maintenance. Which was it? There’s no sense in it being closed because of Covid. Why not just say it’s closed for maintenance?

Why have I given this hotel 2 stars? Because the food served up at the wedding reception was excellent. The room that the party took place in was spacious and beautifully decorated.

This hotel has a lot to learn if it’s hoping to attract customers who expect the best.

text.text:
I recently took the IELTS test at Capitol Hotel in Bengaluru, and I must say it was a fantastic experience overall. The hotel served as the test center for my Reading, Writing, and Listening tests, and I couldn't be happier with the facilities and services provided. First and foremost, the staff at Capitol Hotel were incredibly welcoming and professional. From the moment I arrived at the test center, they made sure that all the necessary arrangements were in place and that the testing environment was conducive to focus and concentration. The registration process was smooth, and they were very helpful in answering any last-minute queries I had.
The testing rooms were spacious and well-lit, creating a comfortable atmosphere to take the exams. The chairs and desks were comfortable, ensuring that I didn't face any discomfort during the long duration of the tests. The hotel's quiet ambiance was perfect for the Listening section, and I could concentrate without any distractions. The technical setup for the Listening test was flawless, with high-quality audio equipment that ensured clarity in the recordings. Likewise, for the Writing test, they provided us with all the necessary materials, including answer sheets, stationary items and pens, leaving no room for stress or worries. Another aspect worth mentioning is the location of the hotel. It was conveniently located, making it easy for candidates like me to find the place without any trouble. Moreover, there were ample parking spaces available, which was a great relief for those who commuted by car. The test administrators were also very professional and strictly adhered to the official guidelines, ensuring a fair and transparent testing process for everyone. I appreciated their attention to detail and how they managed the test sessions efficiently.

text.text:
Absolutely horrid experience. As a foreign traveller, some of the basic amenities we would expect to access are free wi-fi, a breakfast service (inclusive) and a hotel room that you feel  is safe and functional.

Felt like a bit of a prison with no access to TV, no wi-fi, with the rundown state of the rooms - it was just one of the worst things I’ve ever put money towards.

I was duped into thinking this was a 4-star hotel. Hotels are meant to provide a safe haven for travellers. I was not able to communicate with people adequately within the hotel and even a taxi service was so ridiculously hard to book with them (the receptionist stated they were not a taxi service). As a foreigner, a 4-star hotel to me would include a buffet service for breakfast included. Wi-fi in this day and time is absolutely essential and a taxi/travelling service that is trusted to ensure we as travellers can safely travel to and from the hotel is the very least I would expect!!!

Instead, as a group we had to run outside of the hotel and beg on the street for some rickshaws/taxis to flag them down - no idea what a good rate would have been as we were desperate.

No access to food in the morning/afternoon/nights meant we had to figure out the streets of Bangalore with no wi-fi in our rooms to have a plan of where to go or what was helpful.

Furthermore, the state of the rooms (though we were put into royal suites) was so pathetic and run-down.

What a shame that I spent my money here. They weren’t even able to offer us much to keep us happy. We were stuck here as we were helpless. My experience of this hotel is of desperation and isolation. Absolutely unfit for travellers and should not have the label of a ‘hotel’ as it does not keep travellers safe and comfortable.
